result.execSummary:
The defendant Deon E Banks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 95 days time served.The first 5 months: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.
The last 5 months: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. The defendant is eligible for the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim Casey H.
Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.  No positive results.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deon E Banks in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Deon E Banks in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 10 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 95 days time served.
The first 5 months: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.
The last 5 months: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. The defendant is eligible for the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Casey H.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Deon E Banks not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Deon E Banks not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel has not received an offer and requests Scheduling conference.  Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Deon E Banks in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Deon E Banks in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/12/15 @ 1:30 pm
